Biden courts Nevada voters after narrow 2020 winU.S. President Joe Biden will take his pitch for reelection to Nevada voters on Sunday as part of a two-day stop in the battleground state ahead of Tuesday’s Democratic primary. Sun, 04 Feb 2024 10:04:31 GMT FAPHKZYQCZLB5J3T2MI3PTHKDM https://www.reuters.com/world/us/biden-courts-nevada-voters-after-narrow-2020-win-2024-02-04/Jarrett Renshaw世界美国
Two killed in police helicopter crash in southern Turkey -ministerA police helicopter crashed in southern Turkey late on Saturday, killing 2 police officers and injuring one, Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya said in a post on social media platform X. Sun, 04 Feb 2024 06:35:29 GMT 5EOHZP4A5ZNI3GP44LGJVNXWDQ https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/two-killed-police-helicopter-crash-southern-turkey-minister-2024-02-04/Reuters世界中东
Russia says death toll in Ukraine shelling of Lysychansk rises to 28The death toll from what Russia said was a Ukrainian attack on Lysychansk - a city in the Moscow-controlled Ukrainian region of Luhansk - has risen to 28, including a child, Russia's emergencies ministry said on Sunday. Sun, 04 Feb 2024 06:17:08 GMT R7APPCG3XVL7PHPYX2DSS4NMAY https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ Russia-says-death-toll-ukraine-shelling-lysychansk-rises-28-2024-02-04/Reuters世界欧洲
Philippines ready to use 'forces' to quell any secession attempt- officialThe Philippine government is ready to use "authority and forces" against attempts to divide the nation, a security official said Sunday, after former President Rodrigo Duterte threatened to separate some southern islands from the rest of the archipelago. Sun, 04 Feb 2024 05:50:42 GMT QMLC7ZFJOVMM3FT6ZGL2DKMFMI https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/philippines-ready-use-forces-quell-any-secession-attempt-official-2024-02-04/Reuters世界亚太地区
Namibia's President Hage Geingob, 82, dies after cancer diagnosisNamibia's President Hage Geingob, 82, died in hospital early on Sunday, the presidency said, weeks after he was diagnosed with cancer. Australia sweats through heatwave, bushfire risk rated 'extreme'Large swaths of Australia on Sunday sweltered through a heatwave as authorities warned of elevated bushfire risk in an already high-risk fire season during an El Nino weather pattern. Australia PM says government 'examining' claims against UN Palestinian agencyAustralia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Sunday his government was probing claims that some staff of the U.N. Palestinian refugee agency (UNRWA) were involved in the Oct. 7 Hamas attacks on Israel, after Australia paused funding to the aid agency last month. Russian cosmonaut sets record for most time in space - more than 878 daysRussian cosmonaut Oleg Kononenko on Sunday set a world record for total time spent in space, surpassing his compatriot Gennady Padalka who logged more than 878 days in orbit, Russia's space corporation said. Australia PM to introduce bill to reshape tax cuts on TuesdayAustralia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Sunday his government would legislate changes this week to planned tax cuts set to reduce benefits to the wealthy while giving low-income earners more breaks, as Australians endure higher living costs. US, Britain wage strikes against Iran-linked Houthis in YemenThe strikes hit buried weapons storage facilities, missile systems, launchers and other capabilities the Houthis have used to attack Red Sea shipping, the Pentagon said. It was the latest sign of spreading conflict in the Middle East.
